title: Find the Greatest Common Factor
text: Find the Greatest Common Factor of all three terms in the expression.
speech: Find the Greatest Common Factor of all three terms in the expression.
pacedSpeech: Find the Greatest Common Factor of all three terms in the expression.

title: Find the Greatest Common Factor
text: What is the greatest factor of all three terms $$7x^3$$, $$21x^2$$, and $$70x$$?
speech: What is the greatest factor of all three terms  7 x cubed, ,  21 x squared, , and  70 x ?
pacedSpeech: What is the greatest factor of all three terms   7 x cubed,
,   21 x squared,
, and   70 x

title: Factor out the GCF
text: Rewrite the expression by factoring out the greatest common factor.

subHints.title: Divide each term
subHints.text: We can divide each term by $$7x$$, then add those terms together. That will give you the answer of $$7x^3-21x^2-10x$$ divide by $$7x$$.

speech: Rewrite the expression by factoring out the greatest common factor.
pacedSpeech: Rewrite the expression by factoring out the greatest common factor.

title: Factorable Trinomial
text: Given that $$x^2-3x-10$$ is a trinomial, we can try to factor out linear term from the trinomial. Note that not all trinomial is factorable, but in this case, it is factorable.
speech: Given that , x squared minus 3 x minus 10  is a trinomial, we can try to factor out linear term from the trinomial. Note that not all trinomial is factorable, but in this case, it is factorable.

is a trinomial, we can try to factor out linear term from the trinomial. Note that not all trinomial is factorable, but in this case, it is factorable.

title: Methods
text: $$x^2-3x-10$$ is also a quadratic, there are several approaches we can take to factor this quadratic---completing square, Reversing foil, and using quadratic formula.
speech: , x squared minus 3 x minus 10  is also a quadratic, there are several approaches we can take to factor this quadratic---completing square, Reversing foil, and using quadratic formula.
pacedSpeech: , x squared minus 3 x minus 10
is also a quadratic, there are several approaches we can take to factor this quadratic---completing square, Reversing foil, and using quadratic formula.

title: Method of Choice
text: In this case, we will use reverse foil method and leave the other approaches as exercise on your own.
speech: In this case, we will use reverse foil method and leave the other approaches as exercise on your own.

title: a and $$b$$
text: We know that $$\left(x+b\right) \left(x+a\right)=x^2+a b x+ab$$. In this case, our $$a b$$ is $$-10$$, assume that both a, $$b$$ is integer. Then we get some possible combination for a, $$b$$ --- (1 and -10) OR (-1 and 10) OR (-2 and 5) OR (2 and -5). Which combination will both satisfy $$a b=-10$$ and $$a+b=-3$$. Please enter your answer in the form (x,y) by having $$x$$ less than $$y$$.
speech: We know that  parentheses x plus b,  times, parentheses x plus a,  is equal to x squared plus a b x, plus a b . In this case, our  a b  is  negative 10 , assume that both a,  b  is integer. title: Use formula
text: Using the answer you get from last step, write out the linear factor form for $$x^2-3x-10$$ in the form $$\left(x-b\right) \left(x+a\right)$$ where a, $$b$$ are positive integers.
speech: Using the answer you get from last step, write out the linear factor form for  x squared minus 3 x minus 10  in the form  parentheses x minus b,  times, parentheses x plus a,   where a,  b  are positive integers.
